Package org.thormor.provider

Interfaces you must implement to initialize a CVault

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ILocalProvider Implement this interface to let thormor read and write settings, pgp keys, configuration-related data and messages onto the device.
IProgressMonitor A generic way to be notified about the progress of long-running operations.
IRemoteProvider Implement this interface to let thormor access your cloud storage.
 

Class Summary
CDownloadInfo This class contains information about a URL that needs to be downloaded.
CUploadInfo This class contains information about a file that needs to be uploaded.
 

Enum Summary
IRemoteProvider.DownloadStatus  
 

Package org.thormor.provider Description

Interfaces you must implement to initialize a CVault

This package contains two interfaces that you must implement in order to use a CVault.

The first is IRemoteProvider, which connects the vault to online storage of your choice. The primary functionality is that it should be able to create files accessible through publicly visible URLs. If you only create CVault.DetachedMessages, then that is all it needs to do. If you want to be able to do regular CVault.postMessage(java.util.List, org.json2012.JSONObject, org.thormor.provider.IProgressMonitor) calls which end up in the outbox, the provider must also be able to update previously created content.

The second is ILocalProvider, which is a way to let the library save configuration files and messages locally.

Please also refer to the Library Documentation for more information.
